Reviews.Title: “Location for this price CANNOT be beat!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kyla_Ritchie
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest, you're going to NYC to see the sights and the city, not to sit in your hotel room. If you a savvy traveler like my self all you're looking for is somewhere to stay that is perfectly located, clean, has a nice staff, and is within a college students budget, making New York Inn the place you need to be. I have visited NYC quite a few times before, but I have never stayed anywhere that has literally gone out of their way to make sure that my stay was pleasant and that I had absolutely everything I needed. The hotel is tucked away, primly located right on 8th avenue. When you walk in you are happily greeted by someone working at the front desk. There is no elevator so you do have to walk up a narrow, somewhat steep staircase, but people, this is New York City, if you're looking for that kind of service and convenience you better be ready to pay the big buck$$ for it. The rooms are rather small, but like I said before, you didn't come to the city to sit in your room all day. The only time we spent in our room this whole trip was to sleep and to shower. We were given a complimentary breakfast of bagels, croissant, and toast every morning, can you say free food! There is free wifi in every room and a computer available for your use at no cost. You can't get that anywhere. Every morning while leaving the hotel the staff asked if there was anything we needed help finding and made sure to answer any and all of our questions with great knowledge. I will definitely be staying at New York Inn any and every time I'm in New York from now on!

Reviews.Title: “New York Inn - Definitely the place for travelers”
Reviews.Author: gaynde
Reviews.Content: Hi there, i am from Montreal.... I just left the facility; and i wanted to inform my fellow travelers community that i had a great time with the people and staff i met here. After a few days, it felt like i was at home, thanks to the positive attitude and welcoming openess. It was not easy to find a place as cheap in Manhattan, nearby Time Square....I mean c'mon..this is New York ! The big apple ! .... I would definitely recommend to come by and try....

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lotta R
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 9 night stay to the New York Inn because of the price and location. It was in the middle of the holiday season (25th Dec - 3th Jan) and all the hotels were too expensive for us. Sadly, I didn't look at the photos on Tripadvisor, I would have avoided this place. The stairs were disgusting and in mold. Also the "hotel" had an awful smell. There is no lift so we had to drag our luggages to the 7th floor. I almost cried when I saw our room. Everything was covered with dirt, the bathroom was the smallest I've ever seen and covered with mold. We had to wear flip-flops when walking in the room and while taking the ice-cold shower. There was hot water only one time during our stay. The security chain was taken off from our door and other window was broken, covered just with some kind of plastic (!!!) Anyone could have just walked in, cause the lock in the window was broken. Only one plug point worked, others were life-threatening. Not to mention the awful stains in the walls.. The list goes on and on... The "cafeteria" was an old storage room with nasty dirty curtains. Only plus was that breakfast was complimentary, serving bagels, toast and butter/cream. We paid a total 1800$ for this experience. All I wanted was a simple, clean, SAFE room. The day it rained, our roof went completely moist and I could almost feel the roof falling down. I even offered to my fiancee to sell my other kidney if he would take me out of there. But the front desk made us pay the entire stay in advance, so there was nothing we could do. Ok, the front desk was very polite and staff friendly, Also the hotel is situated perfectly. Still there is too much gone wrong with this place. Please believe that this is the worst and most dangerous place you can spend your nights. Avoid New York Inn!!!!

Reviews.Title: “pay a little more elsewhere for a much more enjoyable trip”
Reviews.Author: Jo-Peh
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff, with free subway breakfast everyday, but that's all. Rooms and bathrooms are really small, and there are BED BUGS! The smell from subway makes all clothes smell 'buttery'. No elevator, hence, got to drag luggages up and down the narrow and steep staircase. Seriously, no next time..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: voyage29
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel, great location and service the staff is very helpful and kind, we even had our room ready for an early check in, yes it's an older building but for the price (wifi & breakfast included) and location people should not expect a 5 star hotel in NYC. The manager Kamlesh makes sure that you stay goes well.. many thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “staff couldnt be nicer!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon D
Reviews.Content: i had read the reviews before i went so knew was i was in for, but it was nothing like was people had said, i had a large room, the staff couldnt do enough for us, the six nites we said there. a real bonus free breakfast every morning!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good place for those who are not full of freshness!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisanti
Reviews.Content: Very well located two blocks from Broadway and four blocks from Port Aurhority, next to subway. Rooms are small and always very clean, the staff are very kind people. Breakfast included with croissants, toasts, coffee, juice and more. Internet on the floors and free Wi-Fi in the rooms (available for high prices in most hotels), TV (do not spend your money with expensive hotels NYC has lots of things to spend money than hotels). The building is old and has small entry, but inside the hotel there is a formidable person, extremely helpful, polite, always smiling and well prepared, with a huge heart, his name is Mr. Kamlesh who did not know what to do to please us. My friends and I feel at home and safe!! Thanks Mr. Kamlesh, a big hug from the from the brazilian group.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Bethzaida Liset... R
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in New York Inn, the roow always was clean, and the staff are very kind people. Is a old building but I believe is getting better..

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry, it's good enough! Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Pal H
Reviews.Content: Yes, the lobby smells but that is from the Subway restaurant next door. Yes, the carpet in the lobby is hideous. However... The rooms are very clean. You get breakfast with bagels, toast, croissants and more. You don't get that even in a hotel twice the cost in this city. Free WiFi Free computer in lobby (also not available in expensier hotels) Wide screen-TV The staff is so nice and attentive. Ask them anything and they'll help you. Location, location, location. Even my girlfriend liked it. Spend your money on other things than hotels. Pal from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “its no hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerrie0001
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in such a dirty shabby place in my life. I cannot understand how a place like this is allowed to remain open. I am not a fussy person but there comes a time when you have to draw the line. The condition the size, the smell was absolutely disgusting and would never stay in this hovel again. How is this place not condemned is beyond me if you are thinking of staying here dont it would ruin your holiday. All i wanted was a very basic clean room but instead i got a dirty prison cell it was that dirty i wouldnt even put my feet on the carpet we used to put a towel under our feet or paper bags when trying to have some king of a wash in the disgusting dirty bathroom.PLEASE take note of this and spend the extra few pounds and get somewhere to relax after a hectic day around the city. I have also got some photos to upload to show exactly what im on about. we just stayed in this hovel beginning of november 2011.

Reviews.Title: “New York Inn”
Reviews.Author: Georg T
Reviews.Content: Very central and the stuff is extremely friendly. In New York you will be so busy, that you will just want a bed to sleep. ThatÂ´s the room like, but itÂ´s ok. Mr. Kamlesh and the other stuff manage the service very well and give the hotel another great value.

Reviews.Title: “New York INN”
Reviews.Author: loraine f
Reviews.Content: The Hotel couldn't be more central. The staff are polite and more than helpful with information, and baggage. Yes, the Hotel is shabby but the sheets and towels are changed daily. There is plenty of hot water and shower is en suite. The breakfast offered is more than adequate and by New York standards the price is reasonable. Loraine and Klaus Flury, Basel Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Just somewhere to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Skoda12
Reviews.Content: The majority of commentsvabout this hotel is true, however the building is no longer condemed and (going by the photos on the website) it is much cleaner. The receptionist is very helpful and cant do enough to help you in you inqurey. The hotel is very close to Time Square and a Subway station. This hotel is ideal for backpackers or young people expected a bed and private WC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BM8389
Reviews.Content: Myself and my cousin travelled from Australia and stayed at the New York Inn from the 6th - 20th September 2011. This hotel was perfect for what we paid and in a very ideal location - Only a short 5 min walk to Times Square and only a few blocks from the nearest Subway Station. The staff at this hotel were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was perfect for a start to the day - think croissants, toast, bagels, fresh juice, coffee, tea. The bedroom was only very small, but all we needed for our 14 night stay - 2 single beds and a flat screen TV. The only real downside we had at all was that our shower flooded quite a bit but we just laid down towles which helped this - and the fact that we were on the 7th floor with no elevator - just stairs, but at least we got to work off all the New York food! I would definitely stay here again if i were in New York.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel..)”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: It`s a really nice hotel in the center of NY..i can`t say if you come here you`ll find everything so comfortable..but there are so many good sides of this hotel, that you will never regret about staying there..firstly and the most important, i guess, the personal..they are so affable, always ready to help in every small problem! you will never feel like stranger in this hotel!..if you go out.. you can reach Times Square or Broadway in 2 minutes..so location is really good! When i`ll go to NY next time, i`m surely will stay there)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Udi_Ben_Ezra
Reviews.Content: Hi, I went to there in 10.9.2011. It has great location, the room was clean,the staff is great,breakfeast is nice and it has Wi-Fi. Since it located on the 7th i recomend you to take the interior rooms and by that you will reduce the noise of the traffic. it's not a fancy hotel (the corridors are old fashioned ) but , if you are planning to trvael during the day and use the hotel for sleeping ,have a shower and catching up in the internet it will fit you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location.”
Reviews.Author: Fer4925
Reviews.Content: Very good site ro go visiting the city, it's near to All the famous places and so helpful atention.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, great service”
Reviews.Author: rosyta_20
Reviews.Content: It is a really nice place to stay. ItÂ´s cheap and in the center. ItÂ´s an old building but itÂ´s doesnÂ´t matther the hostel people are very nice and help you in everthing you need. We love this place!!! for sure we come back there!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Oldbrain
Reviews.Content: The place is a perfect setting for a horror movie. Booked for four days but checked out after one sleepless nighmare night. Dirty all over, rotten tubes and and open radiator grids. However, you have a flatscreen tv, and you can hear your neighbours entertain theirselves in the rooms next door. Staff would let us check out without any penalty fee. This is New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jreh81
Reviews.Content: We've spent 6 nights at this inn, and had a very good time in NYC. Main reason was the excellent location of the hotel. Al subwaystations were within a 2 block distance, and Times Square is just one block away. Hells Kitchen, where we discovered some nice - not expensive - restaurants, is also just one block away. 5th avenue/central park is like a 20 min walk from the Inn. All and all: a superb location! The front office staff was very friendly upon arival and very helpfull as well. They really helped out arranging things for us. Breakfast was simple but more than ok. The room was small, but clean(ed every day). For NYC standards it was just what you can expact for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: forthewin1000
Reviews.Content: I will come back, thank you! Not the best hotel I ever have been at but it suit its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great”
Reviews.Author: gustavo_lacorte
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so near The Times Square, the main metro lines. If you want just a place to go to bed is good.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: For some reason every hotel in NY was sold out for the week of June 6th or INSANELY expensive 600+. The one hotel that was available for $200 was the NY Inn. After bookin it, I read the reviewshere and have to say I was terrified at what to expect. I had even prepared to demand my money back if even half of what I read was true. However, I was more than pleasanly surprised. The building is a run down walkup but it is right in the heart of Times Square. The man at the front desk was so sweet and friendly, and even offered to help with my bag on this sweltering NY day. My room on the fourth floor was a big schlep up narrow are rickety stairs (this is a very basic hotel) The real surprise was my room. It was very clean, large enough for two people on close terms, the air conditioner was perfect and there was even a flat screen HDTV with a good selection of cable. The private bathroom is very small but functional and agin very clean. The hotel even serves a lovely continental breakfast buffet wih a good selection of juices, rolls and pastries. Listen, it ain't the Plaza but for a budget traveller who wants to be in the middle of all the action of NYC, the NY Inn is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: danishTLS
Reviews.Content: A low budget hotel at a perfect location, only a few blocks from Times Square. The staff is very kind and helpful. The hotel, including the room, was always very clean.

Reviews.Title: “All that you need for have a good days in New York with a good price”
Reviews.Author: josenf
Reviews.Content: Great location, really kind service, good breakfast and clean bathroom, all that you need for have a good days in New York with a good price.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nanna91
Reviews.Content: My friend and I was warmly welcomed by the hotel staff at the New York Inn. Since we had read so many bad reviews of the hotel, we did not know what to expect. We were very surprised - the hotel was perfect! Yes it is old and could need a makeover, but a side from that, we could not have picked a better place to stay in New York. I myself am the ultimate "cleanfreak" and hygiene is very important to me! And luckily our room was cleaned every day - so nice to come to a made bed and clean bathroom. Our room was not too big, but more than enough for us. And we did not hear ANY noise from 8th ave., even though it's just outside. The location is fantastic - 5 min. walk (or less) to time square, subway station just few blocks away. Also the hotelstaff was extremely friendly and did everything they could to make our stay as good as possible. They were very helpful, and gave us directions for were to go in the city and how to get there. The breakfast was good: a bagel, muffin, crossaint, toast, juice, tea or coffee - all you need for a good start of the day. Overall I will very much recommend this hotel - great service, rooms, location and free wifi and it is so cheap!! Considering the price it was more than great!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO THERE PLEASE !!!”
Reviews.Author: Bundashik
Reviews.Content: After seeing few small pictures on the booking site, considering slightly better price and good location we booked it - FATAL MISTAKE ! Allready when we arrived in front of the hotel we realized the mistake. The short summary is following: a horror, extremely dirty building suitable for demolition, room (190 USD/night) with dimensions 2x3 meters (not joking), complete "bathroom" cca 90-90 cm "gipsy stile" - people from central Europe will understand... and the top was a midnight scream of my girlfriend after seeing a huge rat eating our food half meter from our heads !! An unbelievable experience, which we keep talking to our friends even after one year. Just hope this place is closed and demolated these days allready - if not, please do believe us and DO NOT GO THERE (unless you also want have an "extraordinary experience" :) P.S.: few nice pictures attached :) J&L, Slovakia, Europe

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Rebh188
Reviews.Content: The location of New York Inn is amazing! You can walk for everywhere! Just some blocks from Times Square! The staff is really really friendly and veeeery kind! I really recomend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location at a very competitive rate...”
Reviews.Author: mayangcgo
Reviews.Content: New York Inn Hotel is located strategically close to the major attractions in midtown Manhattan; the hotel staff are excellent in their customer service, and the room rates are very competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent and very kind staff. Best location.”
Reviews.Author: danielssell
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay near Times Square and the theaters that's the best choice regarding prices. The staff was very, very kind and atencious with us, although the hotel itself is a little old and the room is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: facilities41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is aweful No water the first am and when i complained the day time desk guy gave me a bottle of cold water to shave in 2 nd day still no hot water when it was fixed i had to run the water for ages to get it hot In the sink Hot water coming through the cold faucet and vica versa The " Breakfast" offered in Subway was an insult The Day time manager was a jerk The pictures on the internet are nowhere near what this place is about The free internet in the hallway never worked The shower was not cleaned Nice TV but a limited choice of stations a notice on the Reception said no visitors b ut the night guy never stopped anyone coming in He was on the computer the whole time On check out because i was trasvelling solo the guy at the desk said : How can you enjoy a visit to NY if you are on your own? None of his business !!!! Check your credit card charges after your visit there I dont trust them Terrible Terrible place DONT EVER STAY THERE

Reviews.Title: “Rough diamond”
Reviews.Author: Joselita84
Reviews.Content: Upon running into most hotels in Manhattan we found the cheapest! Absolutely fantastic location. If you're visiting to see New York and not stay in your hotel all day this is perfect. Two blocks from Time Square and in walking distance from Central Park, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center (where we saw four proposals!) and lots more. The owner was very helpful and friendly and was willing to give lots of useful information to aid our trip. The breakfast might not be or might be your ideal choice- a subway with coffee and cookie but it sets your up for the day. As it is so centrally located one might have a slightly disrupted sleep but that is the price you pay for being right in the heart of the city that never sleeps!! Special thanks to Gregory.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: kelly4444
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to the location and the price, which both were very reasonable considering it is in cenal NY for a long weekend for my boyfriend's birthday. Our experience was so bad and I was very ill during and afterwards. Upon walking in the hotel we knew it was a mistake. The rooms were falling apart, extremely dirty and completely unsafe. The main issues we had were: I got an electric shock every time I turned the light on and off There were mice or rats in our room which ate the chocolate presents I had bought to take home The room was disgustingly dirty the shower was absolutely shocking and the hot water was turned off for hours most of the days we were there 'to be fixed' the room was so cold, as the window was broken and couldnt close-there are vents at the bottom which were snapped there were no towels until the last day of our stay, so we bought new ones thinking they weren't included (which we were glad about in the end as everything was so dirty anyway using the hairdryer that we had to ask for tripped the lights in the room everytime so I ended up drying my hair in the dark the staff were so rude and incapable of doing their jobs- when I complained the manager brought over the cleaner and started threatening him, even though it was not his fault about all of the above the hotel is above a 24 hour subway sandwich shop that plays one song over and over constantly there is a sign outside saying that some rooms are completely unsafe and should be evacuated immediately Even if you are on a tight budget like we were, do not book here. You will regret it and it will ruin your entire trip. I would rather pay more and have less spending money so that I could have a warm shower and sleep in a clean bed.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: KMRH_10
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a 1wk stay here, and the wk couldnt have ended sooner. This place should NOT be operating. Besides comfort issues such as a very (very!) small bathroom, lack of blankets and a questionable breakfast, there are some real health issues that need to be addressed at this "hotel." The stairs feel like they are about to collapse at any second, I leant on the bannister at one point and almost fell down three floors. The first room we were put in was so filthy I cried when I saw it. After two nights in that room I realised the odd smell in the room was because the water from the back of the toilet was constantly leaking over the bathroom floor. After asking to be moved, we were told to go to breakfast and everything would be sorted. When we came back the manager had forgotten about getting us a new room and we had to wait another 10mins to be moved. Within 1hr we saw another guy being checked into the room we moved out of! The new room was slightly bigger, although the shower was so small I could not reach my hands up to wash my hair. Showers were few and far between as the hot water only lasted a few minutes at best. The window would not close so we asked for extra towels and rolled them up in front of the window to keep the cold out. The heater seemed to be on a half hr timer, so we would have to turn it back on regularly. The sheets were too small for the bed so it was a struggle to keep them on or in place. For the final two days the electricity in our room kept cutting out if we had more than one item on (turning on the light in the bathroom meant turning off the room light first, turning the heater on meant having no lights or tv on). In the end I was making such frequent calls to reception to get our power switched on, the maintenence man showed me to the fuse box myself and showed me how to ref-use our room. All in all this place is an absolute dump and it is dispicable that it is still in operation! What has to happen for this place to be closed down!?!

Reviews.Title: “A good and reasonable option to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: enjoylife37
Reviews.Content: Ubication: New york is a city to walk so the hotel is only to sleep about 7 hours daily so you really don' t need to pay an expensive hotel. The hotel is well ubicated, near is a mini supermarket, fast food restaurants, teathers, timesquare and 5th avenue but the most important thing is that it is cleanand the bathroom was clean too, there is not a mood or smoke carpets odor and the rooms are as you see in the hotel page pictures. The reception staff is ok not is lovely but you only need to obtain some information from them, they are not your family to love you so you can receive from them only a courteous business treat. The only thing is that is better your request a room not infront of the 42nd street because it is noisy. My family and me were confortable, in the room we had a mini refrigerator and microwave oven. If some day I return to NY Citiy I will be stay again in the hotel. The price is reasonable in comparisson with another hotels in NY. Sorry for my poor english!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE DUMP DON'T BOTHER LOOK ELSEWHERE !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Markus_OZ
Reviews.Content: After flying for 6 hrs on the red eye from San Francisco, we finally arrived at the hotel at 8:30am, only to be met by the rudest man I have ever met, showing him our reservation confirmation from booking through there website he told us we had no booking, when I questioned, why he claimed we had no booking, when we had the confirmation in our hand, he started raising his voice and told us to leave. So being tired and in need of some, I told him exactly what we thought of his hotel, with a warning from local authorities on the door about the state of the building and a bed bug warning alongside, so being half way around the world from home, and no place to stay, we went next door to Grayline buses where a lovely man pointed us in the direction of a nearby hotel that cost us $800 US for 3 nights (which blew the holiday budget) being a late arrival we were just glad to have accomodation with the NYC Marathon being held that day. I have travelled to Africa, India and the likes and this is by far the worst hotel I had been in, it stunk and I was only glad found something at the Edison Hotel where the staff were only too happy to help. LOOK ELSEWHERE

Reviews.Title: “Twice along Broadway for two hours by feet”
Reviews.Author: dgrcheg
Reviews.Content: Only these two hours I was in this hotel, cause right after booking I dropped my bag and went for a walk, planning to go up and down for Broadway. In one hour after, for some unexpected reason I had to leave back to Moscow. Quickly rebooked the airtickets I went to hotel and said to its leader, that I will not stay and go away. Before this, I already payed all daytaxe. He gave me back all money with no problem + asked his employer to use his MetroCard for to enter the subway. Its a small thing, but precisely reflect his relation to guests

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adancer423
Reviews.Content: I don't know what some of these peole are talking about when they said it was clean. The Cleanliness= DIRTY!!! When I first walked into the lobbby, I knew I had made a mistake when I booked this trip. When I saw my room, Oh, don't even get me started. Ya know, when I first got in the room it actually looked quite clean. Don't fall for the trap. The 2d night I caouldn't sleep so I went down to the lobby and I taold the person at the desk to give me another room because everything was just plain dirty. For all those people who said this hotel was bad, I'm on the same page as you. But the staff is very nice. It's not there fault that the hotel wasn't good. So the nice man gave me a SUITE!! That was not the cleanliness ever also but it improved so I just said thank you. So that's my story about my experience to the New York Inn. BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel, very good placed”
Reviews.Author: c0lleague
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service. Hotel is placed in the heart of Manheten near Time square. Rooms not large, but very clean and comfortable/

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: trav015
Reviews.Content: rooms (cubboards) are cramped. It has been ages since any maintenaince has been done. Serious doubts about fire safety. The supplied braekfast thru Subways is even worse.

Reviews.Title: “horror show”
Reviews.Author: Fla-Boy
Reviews.Content: DON'T EVEN CONSIDER THIS PLACE -- Everything others have posted is flattering, to say the least -- I am surprised the rats even stick around!!!

Reviews.Title: “bring your own cleaning supplies”
Reviews.Author: adaluisa
Reviews.Content: location - great, front desk - okay, no elevator - expected, bedroom filthy -horrid, since I was booked for the week and no extra funds, I bought cleaning supplies and cleaned it myself, apparently maids do not like to climb steps! I was on 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THE NEW YORK INN ON 7TH AVE. N.Y.C.”
Reviews.Content: Cheapest one I could find @ 165.00 per night....BUT: The room was (according to the ceiling tiles) 10 1/2 FT. square...THE BATHROOM was a closet. THE SINK was hanging off the wall. THE BASE OF THE SHOWER had 4 twelve inch tiles,, so you only have a 24" SQ. shower. THE COLD WATER did not work in neither the sink nor the shower. SHAMPOO AND SOAP included, but nothing to drink out of. No place but the floor for the toilet paper roll. The towel bar is up the wall about 7 ft. so you don't bump into it with your shoulders. THE TOILET almost touches the shower. THE MIRROR is a 12" sq. mirror tile stuck on the wall. THE CARPET looks dirty PIECES OF MOULDING are coming off the baseboard. NO ELEVATOR. HARDLY SPACE to set 2 suit cases. the included breakfast was a trip to a Subway and Papa John's on the street level. You got a dried up egg on an open faced very dry, stale roll COFFE strong enough to raise your hair! OTHER THAN THAT, THE LOCATION IS GREAT, Just 2 blocks from Times Sq. and 2 blocks from the Port Authority Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Epic Fail!”
Reviews.Author: AussieAus
Reviews.Content: Your paying for the Location, times square is close. but dont put yourself through it if your looking to have a nice stay in NYC. The room i was allocated, seriously looked they had turned an office building into a place to call a hotel. Different from the pictures on websites. The bathroom was dirty, the cold water tap didnt have cold water, both taps gave hot water, TV had few channels, your better off not eating at all than having the breakfast provided, dont walk barefoot on the carpet, who knows what you may catch. But the thing you dont want to do is leave sealed food around. If you wanted a private room, too bad theres an in house pet who live there.....and its a MOUSE! The roadent chewed through two plastic packges. I could hear it at night. So after booking this place for 2 weeks, in a total of staying 2 days, this is not worth the money. Your better off paying a few dollers extra for somewhere nice, which is where i am now. Make NYC memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever (June 2010)!!!”
Reviews.Author: MagneSweden
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world. I've been staying at hotels in Europe, China, Africa and USA, both big and small, and New York Inn is by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Even small hostels on the chinese countryside were better. The rooms are tiny and very dark, with a strange odor. The sheets are cover in holes and strange stains. We woke up in the middle of the night because of a strange sound, and when I turn on the light, I saw a mouse run across the floor and in under our bed. This was in June 2010. We wen't down to the front desk and telled the man there what had happened, and he didn't seem surprised. He just asked us if we wanted to change room, which we did. The other room was also in lousy condition. We stayed there for one more night, and then we changed hotel. The bathroom in the new room was a disaster. It was so small that we had to stand in the shower to use the sink, and when we sat on the toilet we had to have our legs twisted or have one foot in the shower. There were also a power outlet in the shower, which is extremely dangerous. I have uploaded some pictures so you can have a look. When we came back the second day, the health services had put a sign up on the front door which said "DO NOT ENTER". There were two police officer in the reception looking for a suspect living at the hotel. The breakfast that is included is a complete joke. It's not a standard Subway-sandwich. It consist of a tiny peace of white bread, a small package of cottage cheese and jam. You won't last long on that "breakfast", so you might as well eat at a good place. This place is a complete disaster, and it is not cheap compared to what you get. I promise that you will be VERY disappointed (and disgusted). Their website states that they are renovating the rooms which is a complete lie. They don't. What they have done is installed flat screen-tv:s, and I guess that is what they call renovating. Everything is dirty; the rooms, the hallways, the reception and even Subway next door. There was even mold in he ceiling. STAY AWAY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hell on earth”
Reviews.Author: SolVoyce
Reviews.Content: When me and my boyfriend booked the place, we read the reviews but thought that it really can't be that bad. Oh lord, were we wrong. If you read this and are thinking about making a reservation for the New York Inn - don't! We first got a room on the third floor. The room was very small, but the size of the room wasn't really a big problem. The condition of the room was terrible. They have bought new flatscreen tv's. Why? There is not a single soul in the world who would lay in bed watching tv in that room. Trust me. On our first night a mouse woke us up in the middle of the night. It was sitting on the floor eating our chocolate. We told the man at the front desk and he didn't even apologize! We got a new room on the first floor, which wasn't much better. There was an electricity plug in the shower, which is really dangerous, the cieling was coming down, and the linen in the bed were torn and had stains on them. The following morning I had bedbug bites on my hand. On our second day the department of health ( i think) had put a sign on the front door of the hotel saying DO NOT ENTER. Two police men were at the front desk looking for someone, who appearantly lived next to our room. When we got back to the hotel after having dinner a mouse had been in our room again! The man at the front desk didn't apologize, he more or less told us that it was our mistake, bringing chocolate to our room. Come on, it's year 2010 in NYC and you should be able to have a Mars-bar in a plastic bag without any rodent eating it. Anyway, we said that we wanted our money back and that we wanted to check out. I have read many reviews, and people seem to be pleased with the service. I'm not that impressed. We had to pay for the first night, but was promised to get the rest of our money back. I hope the money comes back, it's been a week but the money is still not on my account, but I guess it can take a while. This place needs to be shut down, or have major renovations. Sure, the location is fantastic, but that's just not enough. We were looking for a place to sleep and shower, and I'm really sad to tell you that the Inn wasn't even good enough for those simple needs. I would never, ever return. I realize this all sounds unreal, but it was really the worst experience ever. I feel so sorry for the cleaning staff. There's really not much they can do.

Reviews.Title: “Review in one setence?? How about review in one word.... SAVEYOURSELF!”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreRats
Reviews.Content: After reading these reviews and taking a look at the photos of this hotel, to later refer to as ho-slum. One might ask themselves, Why am I here and why would I bring my wife to such filth? But the outter disaster was more comparable to a hotel in Vegas compared to what waited for us behind the bedroom door. Pre-warmed linens by bodies just seconds before moving out. The bodies might have not been there at the second we stepped in, but they left us with their smoke and other "fluids" they felt it was necessary for us to have for an enjoyable evening. Then,since there are no elevators in this slum, one is tired from making multiple trips up and down with suitcases and would like to crash on his bed. I did and was instantly sorry as i found myself laying on the most detestable combination of cigarette butts, sandwich wrappers and those above named fluids. After finally getting these biologically hazardous linens off the bed and to the ground and sacrificing our own clothes to lay them down as a barrier between us and what was under there trying to get us, we tried to relax and fall asleep .This was met with trying to ignore the noises of bugs and mice running up and down the walls. The worst of it all was when my wife woke up and was laughing that i was tickling her toes. I too had just felt that tickle and thought it was her! I quickly put the light on and was met with two black beady eyes with furry body and tail looking straight back at us-in the bed with us! As it tured to run away, it decided to grab some bites of our pizza that had been on the dresser before he ran back to his home in the wall. WE were out of there!

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: annelise048
Reviews.Content: Situated just 2 min. walk from Time Square the New york Inn is perfect for walking around. I found my room clean and quiet. And when I thought I had lost my passport I had the most excellent help and support I could ever ask for!

Reviews.Title: “we recentlly was in this hotel and all...”
Reviews.Author: jordi_marta
Reviews.Content: we recentlly was in this hotel and all was very good. The service was more than excellent, we have new sheets every day, they clean the room every day, they always ask us if every thing is ok, they help us when we didnÂ´t know something, give us maps and a lot of facilities, like if we didnÂ´t like the room they offer another one. I think that is a very good place for stay in NY, near of times square, brodway and the location of the hotel is really convenient (subway,bus...) and have very good price. If i come back i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “filthy filthy hotel”
Reviews.Author: flowerchick57
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have stayed in! So bad I wrote to the BBB and the City of NY and reported how bad this hotel was. Dirty, had to stand on the bed to turn off and on the AC, Frig had a spliced plugin. Stains on the bedspread. Show was not clean, holes in the walls with rags stuffed in them, bug or mouse sticky traps. Stay away from this hotel, it is really bad. Booked through Hotels.com. Now way they ever stepped foot in that hotel. Wrote to them about the hotel and all they had to say was that it met their squalifications Was the last time I used Hotels.com to book anything.......

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Prostitute Den”
Reviews.Author: TyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a few years ago. But it left quite an impression on me. I was just out of college, a single guy, so I don't need anything too fancy. Just a clean place to sleep. If I was travelling with my girlfriend I would be more picky, but for myself, just wanted something cheap. Well the price was about $135. a night at the time, reasonable for a place so close to Times Square. The place is above a subway restaurant, easy to find. The guy on the phone told me "above a subway", I though he meant the underground subway system, not the sandwich place. So I laughed when I arrived. I stayed there for 2 nights, and walk into the lobby to check in. The lobby is tiny, and there are a few women hanging out. I get my key and walk down the corridor to my room and notice a few more women staring at me in the hallway. I later realize that these women are prostitutes. I am surrounded by professional women getting paid to do their thing. Must say a little creepy. I get to my room and open the door, the door almost hits the bed. Smallest room I have ever seen. There is a bed and a small dresser and no room for anything else. My key barely works in the lock, the sheets don't look clean, the carpet seems dirty to the point that I feel uncomfortable unpacking and putting my belongings on the floor. The bathroom is the smallest bathroom I have ever seen, and I end up showering with shower shoes because the floor is covered in mildew. I had a real concern sleeping on the sheets that might have been dirty, but again, I'm a guy and just tried to put it out of my mind. Laying down and looking up at the ceiling, I see about 6, not 1 but 6, ceiling panels missing, so I am just staring up into the rafters. Weird. The main problem was the walls. They were so thin I got the impression they weren't solid, remimded be of partition walls in an office cubicle. The problem with thin walls is the prostite issue, I could hear people having sex all night long. Kind of funny, but if I was with a spouse, this would have really creeped her out. So to summarize, Small, Dirty, thin walls. But very cheap for the area, so if you just need to save money, then don't say I didn't warn you.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright!!”
Reviews.Author: sparklez18
Reviews.Content: I know most of the reviews are quite bad for this hotel, But it's not that bad! The guests there are very nice,made lots of new friends. The daytime staff are not very nice but got on with the nightime staff (much more helpful and friendly) Great location 5 mins from Times Square, the beds and bathrooms are ok......not too nice but they are just for showering so didnt bother me!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Zcjaais
Reviews.Content: This place is just plain filthy. I've seen better hotels in backstreets Africa. The bathroom litterally fell apart on the first entrance. If this city is supposed to be the capital of the western world. I was shocked to see the filthy streets, the abject poverty of the homeless and the sheer hostility of the people that work in shops in New York. Certainly not what you see in the movies.

Reviews.Title: “This is a former hourly residence for crack using prostitutes, etc”
Reviews.Author: paulrmPrague
Reviews.Content: For those that don't know the history of this dump... This was a place that the neighborhood residents tried to have shut down for years. It was a hangout for crack users, cheap hookers, and scum of every kind. I don't know if the current owners are the same as the ones when I lived around the corner, but judging from the reviews here, it doesn't sound like there's been much change. The place should have been torn down 20 years ago. Avoid this place like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: JerseyMojoman
Reviews.Content: i joked to my roomate that this place is a crackhouse, sure enough when looking to plug in tv (it wasnt working) there was paraphenalia laying underneath the bed. the place is filthy the shower had mold and the cieling was falling down. this place should be closed down. i wrote to expedia about the conditions and stated not only should it not be given a single star let alone two it should be banned from their site!!! GROSS!! DISGUSTING!!! FILTHY!!! ROTTING!!! SMELLY!!! NOT WORTHY OF ANY STARS yourre better off sleepiing in a storefront like many of the homeless!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sebasd88
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, with great service, they attend us very well. We recieve what they promise, and all what we need to live in New York. I recomend New York Inn! SEBASTIAN AND GUILLERMO

Reviews.Title: “Pretty near to the center, and very clean rooms. Bed & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WheelChain
Reviews.Content: Very close to Broadway. My first impression was not very good, but it served to my propose of visiting new york and having a clean place for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: Gekl
Reviews.Content: The only positive I can give is that it is near Times Square. The rest.... Vile- the room smelt continuously of Subway food- it got into your clothes and made you feel sick. The room was dangerous- extremely small, no space to walk around the bed,no wardrobe/ cupboard. The bathroom door would not close, the frame around the door was off leaving nails exposed all around the doorway. The covering was off all the heating pipes, the floor was dirty- we could not go barefooted. The stairs up to the first floor moved when you walked on it and the height of the top step was dangerous. Even worse there was no window at all in the room- it felt like a cell. It was cheap- but not that cheap to rent it as it was. It spoied our much anticipated break

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Gaceymay
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing i can write about this hotel is that it was close to Times Square and had a suprisingly large and expensive flat screen tv in the room that did, to my suprise, work. However there was no hot water, no skirting board, nowhere to hang your coat or put anything away for that matter, holes in the wall, exposed pipes in the bathroom, badly fitted air con unit in the window (you could have pushed it out the window), layers of dust behind and under the bed which had no head board attached, (there was one leant jauntily against the wall) and no space in the room whatsover, (staying with friends i saw 4 rooms - all the same). The hotel itself had threadbare carpets, lethal stairs (think narrow, uneven and lots of them - no lift) looked like it was about to fall down and stank of insecticide and pizza (24hr pizza place next to the hotel). I didn't actually see any bugs except woodlice but the sticky 'insect catching' paper under the bed didn't exactly fill me with confidence. In short, if you're looking for somewhere cheap and clean stay in a hostel, not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Like drugs, rats and prostitution? = Stay here”
Reviews.Author: singoLiverpool
Reviews.Content: hmm...how to desribe this hotel? the only good point is the excellent location, situated one minute away from times square. this can be only reason why this hotel has been allowed to stay open. we were greeted on our arival by a cleaner sitting on our bed smoking and watching tv. the door to our room did not lock properly and could easily be opened by anyone applying force. every morning our bathroom was soaked as the bathroom from the room above us leaked into ours. on one of the days of our trip my boyfriend was offered heroin while we entered the hotel!!!!!!! also we were awoken one night by sex orgy going on which probably involved the prositutes that line up outside the hotel (in front of the xxx rated porn shops located next to the hotel) if all this does not convince you to not stay here then maybe the fact that we had mice/rats in our room will help change your decision!!!!! this is a disgusting hotel, thank god new york is so amazing otherwise this trip would have been a complete disaster. please note we are not people who come on these sites to moan about eveywhere we have been and are not high maintenance, this hotel really IS this bad!

Reviews.Title: “Small and dirty.”
Reviews.Author: michelle-9000
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money.After one night we checked out.No water for 3-4 hrs.Room was 7by8.No were to put suitcases except in front of door.How does this hotel pass health & safety codes?

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!! HELP TO CLOSE THIS PLACE DOWN!!!BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: TravelRight19
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend stayed here. the rooms where small, the bathroom door was broken, the main door to the room was iffy. we woke up with bed bug bites. The Department of health needs to close this dump down.

Reviews.Title: “OMG are you KIDDING me?”
Reviews.Author: kimberly211
Reviews.Content: Price and location were fantastic. The Staff were very helpful and friendly. We saw no roaches or mice and everything was relatively clean except for excessive dust under and behind things. Could not charge phones because outlets did not work without the room's blinding light turned on. Cable tv was finnecky. Internet was one computer on the second floor and did not work most of the time. 52 stairs to climb every time we went to our room. Bathroom was ridiculous. Broken fixtures and missing electrical covers. Mold and mildew. I was grateful I could fit my toothbrush on the sink. No room for anything else. No ventilation in the bathroom. Excessively small bathroom like I've never seen. No instruction on how to call the desk. Husband had to trudge down and up 52 stairs to ask for help. No cups. Very little toiletries. Building seemed to be crumbling and it leaked in the foyer when it rained. Breakfast? OMG! Very slim awful choices at subway for 2 hours in the morning. Rooms are so small and so close I could hear everything in the next room. Staff was very very nice, but they really need to take a little time and effort to do some upgrading. Really yucky place. Nice guy working during the day politely told my husband he looked sixty years old when he is 44 and that he should dye his hair. LMAO! Hope he doesn't say stuff like that to the wrong person! Would not recommend this place nor stay there again. My bad.

Reviews.Title: “PEE IN THE BED!!!”
Reviews.Author: meg6199
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BOOK THERE! This hotel is disgusting, I can't imagine how they still can be open!! When we first got there in the afternoon, we had a bad feeling. First of all, the place isn't clean at all, the room is small with a terrible bathroom and the door wouldn't even open completely. The "complimentary breakfast" they offer is at the subway next door. When we got back from a show at 23h30, we decided to sleep in pyjamas and socks because we were so disguted bu the bed. Then we realized the bed was wet at the end. We opened the light and saw it was yellowish. The sheets were soaked but the cover wasn't :S And it smelled bad also. We asked for a refund, but we had to come back 2 days later to argue with the manager to get 75% of our money back. He said they offered us another room and we didn't take it. Pictures will follow.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good location and excellent service, a little cramped and smokey”
Reviews.Author: Rohaa
Reviews.Content: Excellent locaiton (one block from Times Square) and very friendly, helpfull staff. Great if you are staying by yourself and want somewhere relatively cheap and safe to stay in a private room. Room I was in was small but adequate, but stank of cigarettes, and every morning I would wake up with a sore throat and headache. Free wireless internet and breakfast was a bonus. Great value for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere but here.”
Reviews.Author: nmhbh
Reviews.Content: Receptionist had to be called from Subway next door for checking in, but during the time spent waiting for him I became concerned about the cleanliness and overall maintenance on this property. I asked to see the room before checking in, trudged 3 floor to see the dirtiest, dingy, poorly maintained accommodation I have ever encountered. Badly in need of a complete renovation; I declined to check in and asked for my reservation to be cancelled which was done grudgingly.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: Percussive
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this place, it is just HORRIBLE. There were mice in our room (also in other rooms) and we had to buy a mouse trap at 2' in the morning... We are two easy-going students and we just need a clean place to sleep, but this was really the worst hotel we have ever seen. Please spend a little more money then staying in this place. That Pakistani (?) boss belongs in prison!

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God. How do they remain open!!! Do not book!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GIXER69
Reviews.Content: Where do I start! Let me first set the scene. Hotel was booked by the business and was only a stopover for the weekend before our business trip to Ohio. (Seemingly they had a problem finding a hotel in the centre with any vacancies!!) Eventually found out that there was a gay rights parade that weekend! Entrance was anything but appealing. I sent my colleagues in first to survey the rooms. After the 3rd room they finally got something half decent. (I think they over exaggerated half decent!) On seeing my room I immediately left them with the luggage and walked up and down the surrounding streets going into every hotel begging for rooms for the next 2 nights. Eventually helped by a really helpful assistant manager called Luke at the Milford Plaza who at least found us 3 rooms for the sunday night. Nothing for the Saturday night. OH NO, this meant we had no option! Room was incredibly small with the bed jammed between 3 walls. How they have the nerve to call it ensuite with a shower stuck in the corner with both the sink and the toilet both overhanging into it. Did I mention how dirty it was! There was a 1950's dresser with a tv on top with a hanger stuck in for an aerial. A broken A/C unit was stuck in the window which might as well have been a wall as it was so dirty. The bedding was dirty looking and all the skirting boards were hanging off and before I could even try to sleep in this Hell hole we went for some drinks and jammed the suitcase against the door as the lock didn't seem very secure. I know this seems a bit dramatic, but I seriously can't believe that this hotel is allowed to remain open in such a prominent tourist area. If you are sceptical about the review then you are welcome to give it a go!!!! It's worrying that 3 of the better reviews are from people in the UK!!

Reviews.Title: “Like something out of a horror film”
Reviews.Author: LoveNYC06
Reviews.Content: We booked this room online and the photos looked good for the price. I wasn't expecting the waldorf, but I was expecting cleanliness. As soon as they took us up to our room I burst out in tears. Keep in mind this was the week before Christmas and NYC was crowded!! I ask for a different room. They took us to a room they said was "one level up" from the room we were given. It smelled like something had died and they tried to cover it up with spray. You could barely move in either of the rooms and they had no window. I literally broke out in hives and I thought my husband was going to hurt someone. We took all our luggage back down to the very tiny lobby and told them no way could we stay there. I was barely able to breathe by this time from crying and hyperventalating. The girl at the desk said she would have to call the manager to come out. While we were waiting I had called numerous hotels with no luck. Finally one of the hotels gave us the number to the Hilton Garden Inn right up the street. She had a friend that worked there. He got us in for $285 and this hotel is one block over from Times Square. Our issue now was the NY Inn had already charged our card for the 4 night stay there. I called the credit card company not expecting that the Inn would give us a credit and they immediately put a stop on the payment. Once the manager arrived and saw the condition I was in and how irate my husband was he had no problem reversing the charges. Bottom line if you don't care about being clean this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “As Bad as it Gets”
Reviews.Author: R0adrnr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here awhile ago and I have to say that it appears to be the worst value in NY City. It is definitely the worst hotel I stayed in NYC. Not only was the room extremely small, it was in a very seedy portion of the Big Apple. The only plus is that it is a short walk to Times Square. Other than that, I say, stay away from this place! It needs to be torn down and replaced with something that is better suited for the nae NY Inn

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and price, but very poor conditions”
Reviews.Author: sophieDC
Reviews.Content: The place is really dusty and we had to move room around 12:30 PM(when we got back from the city)because our heating was broken. The only room was left (with bathroom), had no window. If you have dust allergy I would not recommend this place. Some rooms has bathroom and it cost total $130 for two/night and it is cheap and very good location. The saff was really helpful, but they could not help much because the building is run down, so could not fix our heating. We would not come back again, rather stay further from the center and use the excellent public transportation to get into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SamB77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through otel.com. I can see why there were only a couple of pictures on the website. New York is ridiculously expensive to stay in, but at over Â£120 per night (now over Â£140 with the exchange rate) I was expecting more than we got. You couldn't argue for the location. It was great, OK, people have complained there was a peep show place on the corner, but you get them in any city. It was right off broadway and times square, in midtown manhattan which is the best place to be for seeing all the tourist sites. You could walk to the train station and most of the interesting sites. But, it was really rough. We had a choice of two rooms. They were equally as bad as each other. The staff seemed nice, though a couple of people didn't seem to speak much English. This was the worst place I have ever stayed in, and my partner who has done a lot of travelling to some really bad places, said this is the worst place he has stayed in for donkeys years. You wouldn't expect it in America. The whole place was filthy. The room was tiny with nowhere to put anything. We scrapped around trying to manouevre round two suitcases in the room. The rooms had a funny smell and certainly hadn't been cleaned in a long time. There were trails of green stuff running down the bedroom wall, and the bathroom door was patched up with pieces of wood and the door wouldn't stay shut. The bathroom was tiny. The world's smallest sink was hanging off the wall, as were the tiles in the bathroom. It was too small for my partner to be able to shave in without great difficulties and the floor was really sticky. The shower wasn't great and there was no hot water in the evening when we tried to shower. I fully expected to find roaches crawling round everywhere, but gladly we didn't see any. The 'contintental breakfast' we'd had advertised was at subway next door and consisted of a bagel with half an omelette, a cookie and a hot drink. That said, it did fill us for the morning but by the end of three days I was ready to be eating something else. We were glad it was in the place next door as I'm sure looking at the state of the rooms, we would have got horrendous food poisoning. The floors were black where they should have been red and we didn't dare walk on the carpet barefoot. We put newspaper down and a towel on the bathroom floor. I'm not a clean-freak or anything but there is bad and BAD. I was pleased to find the sheets were clean, and they did change the sheets and towels everyday. We were worried about what would happen in a fire, the fire escapes we could see from the outside were not evident from the inside and the two people we asked about escape routes didn't understand what we were trying to say. I hadn't seen these other reviews before we went, but will be checking this site in future, as I certainly wouldn't have stayed here if I'd read what people had said. So if you don't mind cleanliness and want somewhere cheaper than other places in a good location then this is the place for you, but if you have any kind of standards and respect for your health I would stay well away. Bad value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from here.”
Reviews.Author: DaniPera
Reviews.Content: It was the worst hotel I've ever been. Noisy, smelly, dirty, small. And I even could choose the best of three rooms, and still it was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! COCKROACH CITY”
Reviews.Author: Kbriggs13
Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever! Roaches everywhere! One so big he could have helped me bring my suitcase upstairs, and the room and washroom were full of them as well! All around dirty!!!!! Never again! In order to use the washroom, you had to walk backwards to get in there! Worst Hotel EVER!!!

Reviews.Title: “outrageously bad”
Reviews.Author: HannahClaire
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness, this place was so disgustingly dirty, cramped, smelly, dangerous. I could go on! I woke up every night panicking that I wouldn't be able to get out if there was a fire or in fact that the hotel had fallen down. I think the walls were held together by staples and when we tested the door to make sure it was locked, the whole wall moved about 5 inches. The room was dirty, had never been hoovered and i felt more dirty after showering. Free breakfast at subway - no thanks! Saving grace was the internet but this stopped working after the first day (perhaps they caught me searching frantically for a different hotel so banned it's use?!) Seriously bad and so not worth the money - we were told we were lucky that we had a private bathroom. There was no room to get to the sink and out plug hole had cigarette butts in it. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever - rat infestation”
Reviews.Author: Kanga84
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The only thing it has going for it is the location. We arrived at 9am from an early flight to the hotel, after previously confirming that the hotel to was happy to hold our bags until the 3pm check in. We were greated by Captain Kazakhstan at the front desk who decided to start yelling at us for beeing there at the previously stated time. After he calmed down he showed us too rooms which were incredibly small and smelt funny. We took the larger of the two rooms which was still only 2.5x2.5m + a 1x1m toilet/shower. The room had numersous holes in the wall covered by tape, the wallpaper was comming off the walls and you could not see out the windows due to the mould. Never the less we spent as much time out of the hotel as possible, upon arriving back late one night we found the front door of the hotel wide open and no one at the front desk, allowing any person from the street to wonder up right outside your door. We repeatedly sore some suspicious people wondering the stair well so security is a major issue!! After buying some chocolates for a gift and leaving them overnight we awoke to find that the hotels rat infestation had a nice feed during the night. The hotel is horrible and i would not advise anyone to stay there, find somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: littledarlene3
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has going for it is location. The room we stayed in was very cramped with barely enough room to walk around the bed. There were holes in the walls and they needed to be seriously cleaned. A complete renovation needs to be completed. The bathroom which was maybe a meter square consisted of a shower, sink & toilet. You had to stand in the shower stall when using the sink. There was also a dead cockroach lying on the bathroom floor. I will not be staying again when returning to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Unconfortable but inexpensive for NYC”
Reviews.Author: lsergio
Reviews.Content: I stayed in New York Inn for a week in october 2005. That was a terrible experience but fortunatelly I was alone. The room and private bathroom were small and dirty. No amenities. The location is good if you don't stress with the neighbourhood - sex shop and peep show shop! But the price was really cheaper for NYC. I payed USD 752,00 for 7 days (taxs included). Finally I don't recommend this hotel anyway. Try another place!

Reviews.Title: “terrible!”
Reviews.Author: zorbajc
Reviews.Content: room was ridiculously small.. no space to move. If luggage was on the floor no space for standing up..terrible! Had to ask for room service otherwise nothing would have been done! Hotel overall is old and dirty! Absolutely disgusting.. not worth the money at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “A moldinfested rathole: digusting!”
Reviews.Author: MrBlackMagic
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the website of a well established Dutch travelagency. It looked nice on the pictures, it surely wasn't the cheapest option and we hadn't read reviews on this hotel... When we arrived over there the friendly Pakistani (or Indian) manager let us choose between a couple of rooms. Not that it made a difference. Every room was crampy and looked as if it could use some serious cleaning, refurbishment and repair (roofplates, windows a.so.). Our room was so small, that I wouldn't dare to house my rabbit in it. But wait a minute, it was big compared to the bathroom, with measured less than one square meter and contained a sink, a shower and a toilet. So if you brushed your teeth you had to place at least one foot in the shower. The shower was one minute Spartan cold and then one minute hot as hell, one minute Spartan cold a.s.o. Unfortunately it was freezing cold those days, so we had to rely on a small heather which hardly gave any heat at all. Even though I caught a serious food poisoning (with flu, cramps) I was so relieved we could leave this moldinfested rathole during daytime. As I read earlier over here, the manager seemed polite enough to ask if we had a good stay when we checked out. I now realize that his 'politeness' is a friendly way of telling you 'bye bye fools' D-reizen.nl: please don't list this hotel anymore on your website!

Reviews.Title: “Stay well away from here”
Reviews.Author: IrishBridetobe
Reviews.Content: Well like everyone else who seems to be saying this place is awful I agree. I stayed there in Nov 05 but only became a part of tripadvisor this week hence late review. This "hotel" is so so bad. There was holes in the floor and even rats running everywhere. One morning we woke up to discover towels all over the staircase. Reason being the rain was coming in!!! No matter how small your budget is do not under any circumstances stay here. You will be in for a very bad time.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place IÂ´ve ever been!”
Reviews.Author: fromstockholm1
Reviews.Content: The minute I walked at the door I knew I have made a big mistake: there were no elevator, so we had to carry our big luggage trough the stairs. The manager told us to pick the room we like, so we made a horrifying tour through this place, to find out that the rooms were one worse than the other. We had a reservation for 4 days, but we stayed only that first night. The next day we run away... There were mushrooms growing in the carpets, and the smell of the room was disgusting. Please, do not go to this "inn"

Reviews.Title: “run as fast as you can”
Reviews.Author: sctraveller40
Reviews.Content: if anyone even suggests that you stay at the new york inn, run as fast as you can in another direction -- it is more like a flop house than a hotel -- it was so seedy that when i arrived (it was booked sight unseen) i wondered if it did an hourly business -- -- each time i entered or left i heard guest complaining to the desk clerk about one thing or another -- this hotel should be removed from all online sites as it is completely misrepresented as as a suitable place to stay by any standards

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay at the NEW YORK INN cess-pit, NY City”
Reviews.Author: Solomons77
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY at the NEW YORK INN My wife and I plus friends from the UK checked in to stay at the New York Inn in December 2007. Having checked in we went straight up to our rooms and were shocked at what we saw. The hotel was generally very very unhygienic. The carpets were filthy, walls dirty and the rooms were disgustingly awful. My wife and I had a broken window in our room, parts of the bathroom shower were broken and the room stank of smoke. The ceiling light was broken and tinfoil had been used to try and fix the conductivity.....which was very unsafe. My friends room was no different. Directly outside the room, there were the remants of another room - ripped up carpet, side-boards, skirting and the like left in a pile in the gangway leading to the emergency fire exit. The hotel was a complete cess-pit and I would urge people not to consider staying there for their own health and safety. The website pictures DO NOT reflect reality and are extremely mis-lleading. To cap it off, the hotel was situated right next door to a seedy sex shop. We checked out immediately and the hotel refused to refund us. The whole experience messed up our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Is there any worse place to stay?”
Reviews.Author: Mocreu
Reviews.Content: Despite of being in New York city for the first time, I was sure, when my check in time that maybe this isn't my right destination. This hotel was the worse place I ever stayed: only stairs to take you up for three floors in a not security walk; apartament door was open before my entrance, by someone that can not been explained by the front desk!; very very dirty bathroom with something that I can not tell you here! to complete , the hotel is situated between a Pizza's restaurant and a 24 hours Peep Show shop. Definitelly, I leaved this place after 40 minutes of my arriving.

Reviews.Title: “scene of a murder”
Reviews.Author: pixiemand
Reviews.Content: Quiet possibly the worst place ive ever had the misfortune to be subjected to. Ive worked as an outreach homeless drug worker and have seen some sights but this is the pits. Yes New York is fab and we only had the intention of getting our heads down here however it was filthy dirty i cant put into words and the pictures do not do it justice. I entered the room and instantly felt unclean. The curtains were black with dirt hiding the rat traps behind. How health and safety regulations have passed this place i'll never know.i wasnt expecting the ritz but somewhere habitable for humans would be good. Yes there was a wide screen t.v but who'de actually choose to spend time in a room of that standard really would need their heads checked. There were loose electric wires hanging from the ceilings-which i tripped over constantly as the room was tiny-this was one of the good rooms!The dodgy people walking in off the street also made it a scary place to stay.The locks on the doors were poor. I phoned upon arrival the organisers of the inn (back in England so out of hours) and was informed that i could reserve somewhere else but ide have to pay for this hell hole anyway! The manager was a pleasant enough guy clearly used to complaints. It was cheap but ive stayed in New York hostels which are far superior-never ever again. We left almost immediately...Take warning.

Reviews.Title: “Value”
Reviews.Author: dan_08
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from New York. I stayed in this inn. Even though people call it a hotel. There was no hookers on the street the whole 5 days I was there. So dont no where that came from. Got in and got othered a choice of 2 rooms. Was in my room within 5mins. Once in the room, there was a big flat screen cable tv and a double bed. Which was good. Enough room in bathroom, to have a s**t, shave and shower. lol! But I was not there 4 the room. It was all about the city. Only 2 mins walk from time sq and walking distance to all the major attractions. The people on reception were very helpful. Even though one of them looked like BORAT. lol! It did smell of subway but I exspected that as it was built in with it. So couldn't complain. Id stay here again for the location. Oh yeah my taxi stopped right out side and I got a taxi outside also when I left 4 the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The Cabie Wouldn't even Stop at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GTtraveler
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on here the day before we left. Unfortunately it was a buiseness trip where the client had booked us a hotel, so I wasn't able to change it in time! THE REVIEWS ARE NOT A JOKE! The taxi that was taking us to the hotel dropped us off over a block away because he did not want to drive down the street (No Joking Here). Walking down the street we passed, no, stepped over, more hookers, homeless people and God knows what else to find the entrance to this place. Entering the hotel, if you can call it that, we encountered the smallest Reception area I have ever seen! The two "couples" in front of us had both just booked the rooms for an hour! The lady finally gave us our key and we walked to our rooms. Walking up the stairs and down the halls was horrible, but nothing compared to when we actually got to our room. As we round the corner towards our room a man comes stumbling out of it!!!! We walked to the door to make sure it was in fact our room, the door was standing wide open and needless to say we saw a little more of a lady than we wanted to. We got out of there as fast as possible, literally running the whole way. We found somewhere and payed for it ourselves!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: memyselfyou
Reviews.Content: took a group of high school kids there and was not that impressed. the rooms were small and cramped some bunk beds did not have the safety rail on the top bunk. Safety was a bit of an issue. would not recommend this for anyone travelling with school group no matter what the kids ages are.

Reviews.Title: “Danger”
Reviews.Author: TouristHouston
Reviews.Content: Well I learned a lesson. If you are concerned about the outside of a hotel and the neighborhood its in Stay Out. This hotel rents by the hour and is dangerous.How the board of health has not shut it down is amazing. I stayed in my room for at least 5 minutes before I left.

Reviews.Title: “Frightning place to stay”
Reviews.Author: J0nesy
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel a day before I was leaving, so was expecting the worse,...to be honest it was exactly as everyone had said. We tried straight away to book elsewhere, sadly New York was booked out for the weekend, a convention was on. We had to stay two nights....we stayed out as late as possible to spend as little time as possible there, the Broadway Inn around the corner saved our stay, the receptionist was fantastic and allowed us to check in early in the morning, have breakfast and hurried a room ready for us. I am trying to recoup my money via my credit card as the hotel adverts were totally misleading. The stair carpets, well I'd hate to think what is living in them, our window glass was broken and the windows unopenable held in place with insulating tape, one window had no curtain instead it had..... a sheet at the window? Shower closet, one foot in the shower and one foot in the loo, with burning water or freezing. A cable TV ...mmmm a TV with a cable attached, no where to plug it in, only a very dodgy looking socket over the other side of the room which would have meant moving both double beds that had no head boards! We laughed to help us get over it, and said at least the mirrors were clean...! We didn't bother complaining, after the comments on the other reveiws I knew it was pointless. We refused the offer of complimentry breakfast... I wouldn't let my dog eat there. When we left the man at reception smiled and asked if everything was ok....as we were leaving early he made a point of telling me that the room was prepaid...we told him with raised eyebrows and in a tone that implied all was not well, but just said "yeah fine"! We felt that he was taking the mickey, he was well aware all was not fine. I cannot understand why this hotel is available, we have travelled extensively and have never found a hotel so disgusting. HOORAY for the Broadway Inn what a superb place :)

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: happytravel50
Reviews.Content: To be perfectly honest I didn't actually stay at this hotel. That's because after taking one look at the room we couldn't get out of the building fast enough. I felt it was safer walking the streets than staying at this hotel. The first sign of something being wrong was when we were checking in, the front desk clerk was trying to convince us to stay somewhere else. Then after the walk up the two flights of stairs and down the hall (the carpet had cigarette stains and butts on it) we came to our room. Only to find - surprise - the door ajar. Leaving my friend in the hall with our luggage I stepped forward to see the room (came this far curiousity made me continue). Someone had definitely been in there and not just the cleaning staff (do they even have any?). Needless to say we grabbed our luggage and rolled out of there as fast as we could. The only reason I gave this hotel a one star is because there was nothing lower. Giving it one star highly overrates it. Please avoid this place if you want peace of mind and a pleasant visit.

Reviews.Title: “Why Is This Place Still Open??? NYC Authorities, Wake Up”
Reviews.Author: SamYes
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I arrived for an unscheduled visit to NYC to find that my reservation at the Night hotel botched up and that I would only be accommodated there the next day. So 2 hours in a cab later I arrived at this dismal hotel. I was shocked by its appearance. It had a dark mouldy entrance leading to the smallest lobby of any hotel i've ever been to. The receptionist really looked like somebody out of a horror movie. However, I had no choice, it was the only room available that night in nyc. I paid $110 for a room with stained sheets (of all colors,yuck), cigarette burns covering maybe a third of my sheets, a corridor that had fights raging on all night long, and a mouse that seemed to be somewhere in the room.. I didn't get even a wink of sleep and checked out at 5am . I'm amazed that this hotel is even open and that it's advertised in respectable hotel websites, have these people even been here.?!! NYC authorities should seriously check this place's cleanliness and safety records Truly the worst hotel in the world and I've been everywhere. Disgraceful

Reviews.Title: “Impossible!!!”
Reviews.Author: georgepaulus
Reviews.Content: Don't even consider this hotel. Yes it's well located, but it's worst than slepping on the street. It's durty. When someone above takes a shower it rains inside your room. I found a condom (used) when I arrived. This hotel must be a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Flea Pit”
Reviews.Author: meabhe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over christmas and could not believe the state of the place. The locks dont work the showers have no hot water in actual fact if it was being used as a hotel in Ireland i think it would be condemmed. Martin Dublin

Reviews.Title: “The New York MIce Inn”
Reviews.Author: Becii
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner and two other friends of ours booked our trip to new york a year before hand. We booked our hotel knowing that it was not going to be a very nice one but when we got there we were surprised. It was a lot worse than we expected. Check in was fine he was nice. The walk up the stairs was pretty hard with two bags each but it was a lot worse when we had to carry them down full of shopping i thought i was going to die.
