It was also very hard to walk up them when you are out all day and your walking all day, my legs felt like they were falling off. It's a great location just one block away from time square. The first night was okay the hotel was a non smoking hotel which was a bit disapointing as if the smoke would dirty the hotel it was already so dirty luckily our rooms were together and the fire exit was outside our window and we could sit out there and smoke probaly werent alowed but who cares! The second night is when we seen the first mouse in our room i was a little paranoid it case it was running around the bed when we were sleeping. The housekeepers only cleaned our room once and we stayed there for seven nights. That was horrible. The batroom was absolutley disgusting it was so small and so dirty i felt sick when I had to shower i just had to jump in and out the bathroom floor would just become a swimming pool during your shower. We had bags of rubbish inour room because the housekeepers didnt clean our room thats where the mice went my friend brought it down to reception and he just laughed at him how rude could that be. My friends also had a mouse in there room and caught it in there rubbish bag and brought it down to reception. We couldnt aford to move to another hotel and we new we wouldnt get our money so we had no choice to stay there. My friends also got two leeks in there room one in the bathroom and one in the room. It is such a dirty hotel i will never return or recommend it to anyone. If you want to stay in a cheap hotel in a great location this is the hotel for you but if you want extra freinds they will be waiting for you. The carpets were old and they were obviously never hoovered in years. Dont stay there if your are an asthmatic as me and my partner are and it dosent help. They really need to get the place redecorated different staff and managment what am i saying they should knock the buliding down and do the whole thing up. Well i cant say much more only you'll see what I'm talking about when you get there if you decide on going after reading all the bad comments about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mice infested closet”
Reviews.Author: Dutchtripper
Reviews.Content: Awfull, Our romantic weekend was (almost) ruined. The room was incredibly small, the bed was old and you could feel the springs. Sheets were thin, to small, and a little torn. The bathroom was really small and you had to wait for 30 minutes for warm water. Furthermor the place was full of mice. We found a candybar attacked in a bag on top of the cupboard. It was so hot you had to turn on A/C but is made more noice than a F16. We complained, got a new room, same terrible story. The managers advised us to leave as we allready paid and would not get our money back anyway. We made pictures we sent to the travel agency, horror

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: fedupagain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Inn for our anniversary and for christmas shopping. I booked it from last minute and specifically asked if, despite the price it was clean and tidy to which they assured me it was. I knew from the minute I arrived it was a load of [-] was working behind the reception which was some marble desk and an old spectrum!! Despite having booked it some 5-6 weeks prior I was told that they had just one room, 207 so we had to take that. As we started up the stairs the smell was awful as it links to a pizza and subway take out, the carpets were black with dirt and it gave faulty towers a run for its money. I though it was a joke. I opened the door to the room which would not have taken much without a key as it was knackered!!! The room was so small the door opened into the bathroom too. How they got a double bed in there is and always will be beyond me. I swear to god I nearly cried when I walked in. The floor had floor boards missing, there was no furniture, the TV didnt tune in, the bathroom had no hot water, the tiles were loose and it was smelly and dirty. I wouldnt put a rat in there let alone a human and charge them. Well I was fuming, I was only in NY for 4 days and this was ruining it for us. We stayed one night and checked out straight away the next morning, trawling the streets looking for a new hotel, eventually finding one to the tune of $550.00 for 2 nights!!! When I told the man at reception I was leaving he didnt ask why because he was clearly used to it andhe didnt seem at all suprised!!! I will be writing to last minute and trading standards if I have to as I cannot believe an english website is allowing this hotel to be advertised like it is some bargain deal!!! I will ensure that I get my money back for the other hotel I had to book. Never ever stay there, it is not a bargain and needs bloody burning down[-]

Reviews.Title: “Small Bathrooms-Great location!”
Reviews.Author: wayne1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in October,and ok it's not the best looking hotel in New York- Shabby looking carpets on the stairways.And there is a strong smell of pizza as you enter,but is that such a bad thing? i'm sure there is a lot worse smells out there. The rooms are very small just enough room to lay your suitcase on the floor-but if like me you're not planning on spending that much time in the room then it shouldn't bother you that much. Now when i say the rooms are small, you'll have a shock when you see the Bathroom as they are tiny and there's just enough room to fit into the shower-i'm just over 6ft and had to put one foot outside the shower. But the rooms were cleaned everyday and always had clean towells, and the cable Tv even worked in my room. The staff were always friendly and even let me keep my suitcase in a spare room after checking out before i left for the Airport. I never once saw any signs of Prostitution or people fighting like i've read in previous reviews, and never saw any mice either. Ok maybe i was just lucky-so my stay wasn't that bad. But if you are travelling to New York with a loved one then i wouldn't recommend this hotel. But like me if you are travelling alone for a few days then i would because i believe it's one of the cheaper hotels around Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: j3nn1f3r14
Reviews.Content: would never stay here again and would certainly not recommend it. the staff were dreadful and the hotel was disgusting and totally dodgey!! the only good thing about it was that it was on a good street and times square was just round the corner! fine if you are staying in it with someone and only for 1 or 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location !”
Reviews.Author: wickfut
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on the second floor. The room was satisfactory, but we did note cigarette burns in the bed cover and obvious neglect to fixtures and fittings. The bathroom was small, but the shower worked adequately. There were some tiles missing by the door , but it was clean and serviced well. We couldn't get a safety deposit box as they were full, but the security card lock seemed to funcion alright and there was a chain, spy hole and dead bolt on the door. The reception seemed to be manned 24 hrs and they were friendly and helpful. There is a constant 'food' smell in the corridor from the shop next door, but it isn't really unpleasant (usually garlic). The best feature is the location, as it's not far from Times Square and the Greyhound Tour Bus starting points. We basically stayed out all day and some of the night and by the time you return, you don't care where you sleep. For the price (comparitively) we couldn't complain. I wouldn't feel happy about staying for more than a few days though.

Reviews.Title: “A health hazard!!”
Reviews.Author: choclate
Reviews.Content: It was the worst hotel i ever saw let alone stayed in!! It smelt, was damp & was filthy. We also had to share a bathroom which was pretty gross, what hotel nowadays has shared bathrooms??? Nobody should stay here!! We stayed out of necessity as every other hotel was booked out, although think i would have preferred sitting in a 24hr cafe!

Reviews.Title: “Dont even consider this place”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for St.Patricks day 06.By far the worst "hotel" ive ever been to.One night we even found a girl unconcious on the 2nd floor.In fairness,the location is great,but thats it.Toilets flood,no hot water,and the lock on our door was faulty.Rooms are tiny also.Doesnt matter how little a budget your on,I would advise anyone to avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nerea1
Reviews.Content: We stated at New York Inn for some nights on a holiday trip paid in advance and I would like to mention that noone that values safety and sanity should stay there.This hotel was less than appropriate. All was really dirty and neglected and the worst of all is that we saw a mouse one night !! The room and the carpet were really filthy and there was even toilet paper on the ceiling to cover a hole!!!! DonÂ´t go there if you can avoid it !!! Staying there can change a wonderful memory of NY city into a nightmare!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Unique NYC Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My father and I went through New York City on the way home to Ottawa from Baltimore in August of 2004. We didn't get into Manhattan until about 9 pm, and by that time, all the hotels in the Times Square area were booked for the night (no surpises there). We ended up staying at the New York Inn because there were no other options available to us. It is a little hole in the wall, beside a Subway, facing out onto 8th avenue. However, the desk clerk was very friendly, and also referred us to a nice, inexpensive parking garage owned by a friend. Our room was small but comfortable - the television worked, it was clean, and it had a nice view out the fire escape facing 8th ave. The bathroom door didn't close very well but it was certainly serviceable. We loved it exactly for the dingy, disreputable atmosphere. It is a caricature of a New York motel, and of course cheaply priced. At no point did we feel unsafe, though we only stayed there for the one night. If you're on a budget and have a good sense of humour and adventure, the New York Inn is a neat experience in a very convenient location. Honestly, I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad experience at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Seriously.... for only 125.00 a night, close to a lot of attractions....the location wasn't as bad as all these people are whining about. Sure the rooms were small, but all in all if you're on a budget and you don't mind a small room then go for it. i'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enter At Your Own Risk! ”
Reviews.Author: brny
Reviews.Content: Unless you have a death wish, skip this hotel and spring for a better one elsewhere. The hotel is in a good location but that's about it. It's a total dump! Check-in is a nightmare. The clerks barely speak English and are not very friendly. I booked my room online and prepaid with a credit card. When I got to the hotel the clerk claimed he couldn't find my reservation so he said he needed my cc just for records. I later found out that he ran the card through so I paid 2xs for this (-)! The hotel is in such bad shape. Everything needs to be remodeled. The room was the size of a closet. Very dirty and the tv & heat were not working. Walls are paper thin so you hear all other guests (not that there are many!!). Bathroom was too gross to even use. It was nothing like it is shown online. I was not expecting Trump Plaza but this was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Well Away this is a --hole!!!”
Reviews.Author: cinnamonangel73
Reviews.Content: Hi! I went to New York for the first time in 2002, alone a female traveller and on a budget. I booked through Expedia and thought "Hey it must be ok if Expedia book it for you!" well how wrong can a person be! I arrived really late from the UK and was shown to the first room, the lock didn't even lock secure at all and the window view was another brick wall. The bathroom was shockingly disgusting and the base of the bed had a big massive hole in it (God only knows what was living in there!) Well I thought, Im not having this so went back down to the desk and complained. The man moved me to another room and it was just as horrid with screaming and shouting coming from next doors room. I thought to myself, if I don't laugh, I'll cry! and wondered what to do alone in such a flea pit. I decided that I really could not stay in the hellhole and went down again and kicked up a stink and demanded my money back. He tried to fob me off saying it was a credit card booking so I couldnt get a refund but I argued my case and the guy said he would book me into his friends hotel instead. Thankfully this turned out to be the Howard Johnson on 34th Street near Macy's which was cool. What an experience! do yourselves a favour avoid this hotel at all costs. And yes it is sandwiched between sleazy s-- shops!

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe the bad reviews - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week on our honeymoon last May. We were on a tight budget as we had already done two weeks down the East coast. Had I read these reviews before booking I would not have booked which would have been a shame. The hotel IS next to two sex shops but a brilliant location for the theatre district. However, it is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The restaurant is through the back door into Papa John's next door where a brilliant man (unfortunately and Arsenal supporter!) does breakfast, bagels etc... The rooms are cleaned every day. The bathrooms are tiny - well microscopic and we did have water running onto the tiles from the floor above but they sorted that out pronto. If you accept that you are paying practically nothing for a room in a fab location in New York then it is fine. We were on the second floor at the front so I don't know what the rooms higher are like. When they knew we were on honeymoon they moved us down as we were originally supposed to be on the 4th floor. If you treat this hotel as it is and are prepared to have a good laugh and accept you are only sleeping there then it is a good cheap stay. Having said all this not the place for a girly weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Vile, Dispicable, Disgusting Brothel (this is surely NOT a hotel?????)”
Reviews.Author: jessica1982
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that sites like expedia etc are advertising this place- I have never seen anything like it in my life... I never believed that I would see anything like this in New York City... this is the sort of place you'd expect to find in a third world country and the kind of place you have nightmares about, not the sort of place you'd pay good money to stay in. Our room was on the fourth floor- there are no elevators and the stairs are falling apart- LITERALLY! I fell over whilst lugging my bag up a staircase and stepping on a step that turned out to be only half there. The place STINKS of musty old pizza (as there was a Subway underneath it) all the way through, even on the fourth floor. The lobby is pokey, dirty, the staff were smoking at the reception, they hardly spoke any English and were about as friendly as Hitler. Now for the bedroom itself... here are just some of what you can expect if you stay here: -Broken window which was taped up with parcel tape and cardboard -View of a brick wall -Cheap, broken heaters -Wardrobe with door falling off -Chewing gum and USED --- under bed -Prison-type locks on doors -Totally unsound-proof rooms -Hookers as neighbours -Bathroom the size of a cupboard -Unstable toilet -Un-enclosed shower so that when you showered, water flooded the whold bathroom -Filthy carpets -Very smelly throughout -Almost non-existent sheets that smelt and probably hadn't been washed -Dark and dingy This truly is shocking and unbelievable. Totally amazed that a place like this exists to the public. I wouldn't even let a dog sleep in this dive and can't understand how or why it is still open, let alone being advertised worldwide. It will spoil your stay in such a fabulous city. It cost me Â£350 for a 3 day trip to this place: for Â£400 I could've stayed in a respectable 3 star hotel. This is not even a 1 star. It is the biggest heap of crap I've ever seen. If you're thinking of staying there.......DON'T!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore all the Negative Reviews at your own risk !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our West coast relatives booked the hotel for 2 nights, despite our warnings from this site. Luckily, we brought them beddings,towels & sleeping bag & bug repellant. The hotel was worse than I imagined. The room was very dirty and just bigger than the 2 beds and lit by 1 bulb. We were afraid to walk barefoot on the carpet. Only 1 person can move around at a time. The cabinet drawers were useless since they were only inches from the bed. The TV signal was so bad, you can only listen to the show. The showerhead was missing and the shampoo bottles must have been refilled many times over. The A/C was dirty and blowing dust when you turn it on. There was a busted electric heater with frayed wires sticking out. The stairs were creaky, too steep and very dangerous. The room smelled of not having been cleaned in a very long time. Our relatives couldn't sleep nor turn off the lights for fear of rats scurrying around. We had to take them home the next day, despite paying for 2 nights. You are better off in some hotels, even if they have shared bathrooms. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Mouse trap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do you know the meaning of the word "Disgusting"? That,s the best I can find to describe this ------ hole which shouldn,t be called hotel at all. Ok, first night they gave us a smelly, dirty, about to tumble down room. On the next morning, we go downstairs (if you can call those slippery things stairs ) and very politely ask the guy to give us a cleaner room. He did and we spent the second night. The room was a bit cleaner, but still disgusting. To our surprise, we woke up at 7 30 am to the sound of a mouse, or rat, we are not sure to this point what it was. You can imagine we didnot want to try another room in that filthy place. The guy downstairs said the hotel was full so he offered us another hotel down the road, which was normal and pleasant to stay in. Do not dare reserve a room at New york Inn, it will spoil your stay in an otherwise very interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “House of mouse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The carpet in our bedroom was old and filthy, and so was the bed cover. The bathroom hadn't been cleaned and it was so tiny you could hardly move around in it. In general it was the dirtiest place we had ever been to.We got 2 rooms in 2 days, in the second one there was a mouse, we should have suspected this when we saw that big white cat wandering about as we were checking in. Thinking of the stay in New York Inn still makes me feel sick.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Like the Plague”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A dirty health trap, which should be avoided in all circumstances. Should be closed. The worst hotel I have stayed in anywhere. Stairs are damaged and rotten. Rooms are smelly, dirty, cold and noisy. Could not wait to get out of it and wish I had gone by my instincts and booked in elsewhere. Truly awful

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disgusting, dirty, hotel. I have traveled all over Asia on a shoestring and this was my worse hotel experience. $125 for a very dirty room with no bathroom, no heat, no blanket (only dirty bedspread), and a third story walkup. I was only staying for one night, arrived at 1 a.m. and figured I could stand anything, but when I lay down and heard loud talk next door about drugs, prostitution and money payments, and a strong easily detectable smell of an illegal substance, I packed up, demanded my money back and got out of there. Among other things, it was a fire trap and, as someone else included in their review which I should have read before I arrived, should be condemned. At 3 a.m. I went to a great (and cheaper) hotel for those on a budget: Hotel 17 on 17th Street between 2nd and 3rd avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Hooker Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived from England having spent 24 hours in transit, the cab driver stopped outside a sex shop, next to which was the New York Inn. Ok, so we're broad-minded, however when we entered it was like something from a Starsky & Hutch setting. The reception was filthy and the corridors were dated and dimly lit - that's the best part of the place! The room initially looked ok with cleanish bedding, so we started to unpack. Went into the closet-sized bathroom, looked above and there was a gaping hole left by missing tiles. The sink was "Barbie-size" and dirty; can't imagine how you could use the shower without placing a foot in the toilet. At this stage we were still reconciled to the fact that we were in New York and determined to make the best of it, however, when we couldn't lock our room door and during our efforts, heard a "gang bang" next door, we thought it was time leave!

Reviews.Title: “absolute crap hole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: arrived to a strong smell of pizza and subway. the place was dirty and horrible. The stairs felt like they was going to collapse. The room was disgusting people who have stayed there know that is not a lie. Even the door to the room was broken. The roof had insulating foam sprayed in the corners and gaps which confused me at first but i soon realised why, all you hear all night is insects running on the tiles. The owner was not helpful one bit and was only interested in money. The bathroom was terrible electric sockets was hanging on the wall with exposed wires. It was like something out of a film, i know it was a budget hotel but to be honest id have rather slept in the airport. Avoid at all costs, its worth paying a little more to get a decent hotel and enjoy your stay in new york, that place depresses you!

Reviews.Title: “Holy Crap Hole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Never ever stay at the New York Inn, very shady. First room we were sent to the bed looked like it was still being slept in and there were soda cans laying all over the floor. 2nd room we never actually had a key that worked. I thought the steps were going to cave in as we walked up. Not to mention the stains on our rooms walls and filth all along the floor boards. And to top if off their was glitter all over the bedspread...what we called Hooker Glitter. Needless to say we went straight out and found another hotel. I would rate this a top notch flop house. My wife has stayed in Hostiles all over Europe that are nicer than this dump! Do not stay here unless you are on crack!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jingles01
Reviews.Content: Went for price, thinking how bad can it be! First room that we were given had water coming out of the ceiling in the bathroom. Was assigned another room. Room was clean....sheets ok....but the room itself was very small. Blown-in insulation sticking out everywhere. Bathroom, well it was clean, but it was very interesting. Desk clerks were very nice and when we asked for more pillows we got them. As I said, we went for low price as we knew we wouldn't be spending much time in our room, but, it was a little scary.

Reviews.Title: “Safety Issues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Located just outside Times Square, the aroma of the downstairs Subway leaks through the walls. Be sure to check behind closed curtains, there might be a second door sealed off with duct tape. Make sure you request a room with only ONE door. You might want to wear a few layers of clothes, because the heater/air conditioner, stuffed with paper, was unplugged. Check to make sure there's a smoke detector in the room, and maybe bring yourself a makeshift chain lock for the door. I wouldn't bring or leave any food in the room, otherwise you might wake to a light rustling in the middle of the night, and its not coming from your HUMAN roommates. If you're looking for a cheap place to stay, this is definitely cheap. Good Luck to all who choose to stay there.

HotelInfo.Name: New York Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 765 8th Avenue, Between 46th & 47th St, New York City, NY 10036
